meanings.definition: Having a flat-topped or convex flower cluster in which the individual flower stalks grow upward from various points on the main stem to approximately the same height.
meanings.sent1: The corymbed flowers in the garden were all at the same height.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the corymbed arrangement of flowers.
meanings.sent3: The corymbed flowers looked like a colorful pyramid.
meanings.sent4: The corymbed display of flowers stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The corymbed flowers created a beautiful pattern in the garden.

meanings.definition: To form or grow in a corymb.
meanings.sent1: She carefully corymbed the flowers for the centerpiece.
meanings.sent2: The flowers corymbed gracefully in the vase.
meanings.sent3: He decided to corymb the flowers in a unique shape.
meanings.sent4: The flowers seemed to corymb together naturally.
meanings.sent5: The way the flowers corymbed added elegance to the room.
